result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio C Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 05-01-16 or serve 15 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders 11 days jail.  11 days credit applied.  Time Served.
The court orders the Defendant have no further shoplifting charges.  If the Defendant does not comply with the Court order, the Defendant shall serve a penalty of 20 days jail

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio C Santiago

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Antonio C Santiago in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
Count #1:
JAIL:  11 DAYS (apply 11 days credit for TIME SERVED).
FINE: $515.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 5/1/16 or serve 15 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment).   
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month conseuctive to payment of fine).
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
OTHER: The Court orders the Defendant If the Defendant does not comply with the Courts order the Defendant shall serve a penalty of 20 days jail.

Defendant Antonio C Santiago in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek has received discovery and an offer.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact withany Kohl's Department Stores.

ADDRESS INFO for Antonio C Santiago
Current: 311 Sentinel Drive, Waukesha, WI 53189   (Effective: 01-29-2016)
Prior: 1212 Fleetfoot Dr,#112, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant Antonio C Santiago in court in custody.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Antonio C Santiago not in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
